LocationSmyrna, GAProject/Unit DescriptionGTRI’s Antenna Systems Division (ASD) in the Sensors and Electromagnetic Applications Laboratory (SEAL) seeks qualified candidates for the position of a senior/principal Operations Analyst. This position involves applying operations research and analysis techniques to solve challenging real-world problems related to national defense.SEAL consists of a staff of research professionals engaged in a portfolio of research related to next-generation Air Traffic Control technology analysis and innovation, including RF sensor physics, signal processing algorithms and techniques, effects-based modeling and simulation, verification and validation, advanced threat analysis, and operations research/developmental planning. SEAL develops tailored solutions for a broad range of national security challenges through disciplined application of physics- and effects-based modeling to realizable systems, culminating in prototype development and testing.The Operations Analyst will provide subject matter expertise on current and future Air Traffic Control (ATC) systems, US and allied aircraft systems, ATC tactics, and military ATC radar technologies. The successful candidate will support projects and programs to meet sponsor objectives, working with sponsors, engineers, and GTRI management to achieve success. They will also participate in sponsor engagement efforts to identify potential growth opportunities, develop proposals, and manage business lines. The ideal candidate would have direct knowledge of operation of the current family of Naval SPN (Surface Radar Navigation) systems.Job PurposeThe Operations Research Systems Analyst (ORSA) applies advanced analytical and systems engineering methods to help make better decisions. Researches, develops, and integrates new and existing system simulation frameworks, prediction models, logical models, and analyses. Models operational environments, performs trade studies via computer simulation and provides decision support for alternative architectures. Designs and/or develops decision support tools that integrate modeling and simulation into intuitive and interactive graphical user interfaces. Performs trade studies via computer simulation and provides decision support for alternative architectures. Elicits information from Subject Matter Experts and stakeholders, and iterates with them to develop qualitative models of their expertise and/or needs. Utilizes applied statistical analysis, machine learning, optimization, and visualization to support defensible decisions and decision processes. Conceptualizes, designs, and/or develops software solutions to implement system simulations, models and analyses. Develops, integrates, and tests software or conceptual ideas to implement decision making methods and processes. Develops methods, processes and/or software tools to help design, integrate and manage complex systems and system engineering processes.Key ResponsibilitiesManage all technical aspects of supporting defensible decision making, including directing multiple lab resources for large scale product or system deployments.Manage sub-contractor resources supporting all system engineering areas.Develop and implement approaches to address the customers' needs within schedule and budget.Develop technical reports detailing models used and processes followed for developing or arriving to a decision support solution. Review and verify work-products are consistent, accurate (if feasible given the limitations of the project and data available), and that they address the needs of the customer.Mentor and support the teaching and training of Entry, Growing, and Career level researchers. Additional ResponsibilitiesStrong leadership and communications skillsExperience in preparation and briefing of technical presentationsDesign and lead the development of future system training materialsAbility to travel to support sponsor IPT needsProvide peer review of key project deliverablesOther duties as assigned Required Minimum Qualifications Minimum of 10 years experience with Naval Air Traffic Control systems Experience with Naval ATC trainingPreferred QualificationsActive Top Secret ClearanceDirect experience in the operations and sustainment of the Navy SPN-35 and SPN-46 systemsExperience in formal instruction course development, training techniques, course material development, and training managementOperational experience with the Navy SPN systemsManagement experience with the Navy SPN systemsFamiliarity/experience with the DoD system development and delivery life cycle Travel Requirements10% - 25% travelEducation And Length Of ExperienceThis position vacancy is an open-rank announcement. The final job offer will be dependent on candidate qualifications in alignment with Research Faculty Extension Professional ranks as outlined in section 3.2.1 of the Georgia Tech Faculty Handbook9 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related field.7 years of related experience with a Masters’ degree in Aerospace, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related field. U.S. Citizenship RequirementsDue to our research contracts with the U.S. federal government, candidates for this position must be U.S. Citizens.Clearance Type RequiredCandidates must be able to obtain and maintain an active security clearance.Benefits At GTRIComprehensive information on currently offered GTRI benefits, including Health & Welfare, Retirement Plans, Tuition Reimbursement, Time Off, and Professional Development, can be found through this link: https://hr.gatech.edu/benefitsDiversity & InclusionDiversity & Inclusion (D&I) at Georgia Tech Research Institute aims to enhance the Institute’s mission of solving the world’s most complex technical problems by creating a workforce with a shared appreciation for diversity, raising awareness around inclusiveness, and fostering a sense of belonging and appreciation for all members of our community.Equal Employment OpportunityGeorgia Tech Research Institute is an Equal Opportunity Employer of individuals with disabilities and protected veterans and actively seeks diversity among its employees.
